intro: Seseli devenyense, commonly known as the Transylvanian seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Carpathian region, particularly found in Hungary and Romania. The plant features a basal rosette of finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
